sn6.5:1.2: Now on that occasion the following evil speculative view had arisen in a certain brahmā:
sn6.5:1.3: “There is no ascetic or brahmin who can come here. ”
sn6.5:1.4: Then, having known with his own mind the reflection in that brahmā’s mind, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his drawn-in arm or draw in his extended arm, the Blessed One disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that brahmā world.
sn6.5:1.5: The Blessed One sat cross-legged in the air above that brahmā, having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:2.1: Then it occurred to the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna:
sn6.5:2.2: “Where now is the Blessed One dwelling at present?”
sn6.5:2.3: With the divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna saw the Blessed One sitting cross-legged in the air above that brahmā, having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:2.4: Having seen this, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his drawn-in arm or draw in his extended arm, the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that brahmā world.
sn6.5:2.5: Then the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna stationed himself in the eastern quarter and sat cross-legged in the air above that brahmā—though lower than the Blessed One—having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:3.1: Then it occurred to the Venerable Mahākassapa:
sn6.5:3.2: “Where now is the Blessed One dwelling at present?”
sn6.5:3.3: With the divine eye … the Venerable Mahākassapa saw the Blessed One sitting cross-legged in the air above that brahmā…
sn6.5:3.4: Having seen this, … the Venerable Mahākassapa disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that brahmā world.
sn6.5:3.5: Then the Venerable Mahākassapa stationed himself in the southern quarter and sat cross-legged in the air above that brahmā—though lower than the Blessed One—having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:4.1: Then it occurred to the Venerable Mahākappina:
sn6.5:4.2: “Where now is the Blessed One dwelling at present?”
sn6.5:4.3: With the divine eye … the Venerable Mahākappina saw the Blessed One sitting cross-legged in the air above that brahmā… .
sn6.5:4.5: The Venerable Mahākappina disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that brahmā world.
sn6.5:4.6: Then the Venerable Mahākappina stationed himself in the western quarter and sat cross-legged in the air above that brahmā—though lower than the Blessed One—having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:5.1: Then it occurred to the Venerable Anuruddha:
sn6.5:5.2: “Where now is the Blessed One dwelling at present?”
sn6.5:5.3: With the divine eye … the Venerable Anuruddha saw the Blessed One sitting cross-legged in the air above that brahmā…
sn6.5:5.4: Having seen this, … the Venerable Anuruddha disappeared from Jeta’s Grove and reappeared in that brahmā world.
sn6.5:5.5: Then the Venerable Anuruddha stationed himself in the northern quarter and sat cross-legged in the air above that brahmā—though lower than the Blessed One—having entered into meditation on the fire element.
sn6.5:6.1: Then the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed that brahmā in verse:
sn6.5:7.1: “Today, friend, do you still hold that view,
sn6.5:7.2: The view that you formerly held?
sn6.5:7.4: Surpassing that in the brahmā world?”
sn6.5:8.1: “I no longer hold that view, dear sir,
sn6.5:8.2: The view that I formerly held.
sn6.5:8.4: Surpassing that in the brahmā world.
sn6.5:9.1: Then, having stirred up a sense of urgency in that brahmā, just as quickly as a strong man might extend his drawn-in arm or draw in his extended arm, the Blessed One disappeared from that brahmā world and reappeared in Jeta’s Grove.
sn6.5:9.2: Then that brahmā addressed one member of his assembly thus:
sn6.5:9.3: “Come now, dear sir, approach the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna and say to him:
sn6.5:9.4: ‘Sir Moggallāna, are there any other disciples of the Blessed One that are as powerful  and mighty ”
sn6.5:9.5: as Masters Moggallāna, Kassapa, Kappina , and Anuruddha?’
sn6.5:9.6: “Yes, dear sir, ” that member of Brahmā’s assembly replied. Then he approached the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna and asked him:
sn6.5:9.7: “Sir Moggallāna, are there any other disciples of the Blessed One that are as powerful and mighty
sn6.5:9.8: as Masters Moggallāna, Kassapa, Kappina , and Anuruddha?”
sn6.5:9.9: Then the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna addressed that member of Brahmā’s assembly in verse:
sn6.5:10.2: Skilled in the course of others’ minds.
sn6.5:10.3: Who are arahants with taints destroyed,
sn6.5:10.4: “Many are the disciples of the Buddha ”
sn6.5:11.1: Then that member of Brahmā’s assembly, having delighted and rejoiced in the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna’s statement, approached that brahmā and told him:
sn6.5:11.2: “Dear sir, the Venerable Mahāmoggallāna speaks thus:
sn6.5:12.2: Skilled in the course of others’ minds.
sn6.5:12.4: “‘Many are the disciples of the Buddha.’”
sn6.5:13.1: This is what that member of Brahmā’s assembly said.
sn6.5:13.2: Elated, that brahmā delighted in his statement.
